prerequisites.fi: ELEC-C8001 Sähköenergiatekniikka (Power Engineering) or equivalent knowledge.
prerequisites.sv: ELEC-C8001 Sähköenergiatekniikka (Power Engineering) or equivalent knowledge.
prerequisites.en: ELEC-C8001 Sähköenergiatekniikka (Power Engineering) or equivalent knowledge.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of the course the student can:
1. Calculate the magnetic response of a magnetic circuit
2. Explain the principles of electromechanical energy conversion and power losses
3. Describe the construction of different electrical machine types and their operation
4. Build an equivalent circuit of an electrical machine
5. Use equivalent circuits to calculate the steady-state operation quantities of electrical machines

prerequisites.fi: ELEC-E8001 Embedded Real-Time Systems (or S-81.2200 Sulautetut mikroprosessorijärjestelmät)
prerequisites.sv: ELEC-E8001 Embedded Real-Time Systems (or S-81.2200 Sulautetut mikroprosessorijärjestelmät)
prerequisites.en: ELEC-E8001 Embedded Real-Time Systems (or S-81.2200 Sulautetut mikroprosessorijärjestelmät)

learningOutcomes.fi:
On successful completion of this course, the student will be able to:
1. Present the typical life-cycle models for developing embedded systems; both sequential models and agile ones
2. Apply a variety of requirements engineering methodologies for specifying embedded systems
3. Apply commonly used design specification techniques for embedded systems
4. Select and tailor appropriate testing schemes for embedded hardware/software systems
5. Describe a set of effective performance analysis techniques for real-time systems
6. Justify/criticize technology forecasts on the future of real-time systems hardware, software, and applications

prerequisites.fi: ELEC-E8413 Power Systems or comparable knowledge
prerequisites.sv: ELEC-E8413 Power Systems or comparable knowledge
prerequisites.en: ELEC-E8413 Power Systems or comparable knowledge

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon successful completion of the course, the student will be able to:
1. recall the different fields of high voltage engineering,
2. inspect the behavior of different insulators in electric fields and describe their related breakdown processes,
3. identify different high voltage equipment, apply measuring and testing techniques, as well as examine how different voltage stresses affect insulators and systems,
4. collect and construct the necessary tools to continue research in the field of high voltage engineering.
learningOutcomes.sv: Upon successful completion of the course, the student will be able to: 1. recall the different fields of high voltage engineering, 2. inspect the behavior of different insulators in electric fields and describe their related breakdown processes, 3. identify different high voltage equipment, apply measuring and testing techniques, as well as examine how different voltage stresses affect insulators and systems, 4. collect and construct the necessary tools to continue research in the field of high voltage engineering.

learningOutcomes.fi: Upon completion of the course, the student will - understand the principles of the finite element method - be able to use a finite element software to model electrical machines - understand the numerical methods to deal with nonlinearity and time dependencies - understand how the materials and sources are numerically modelled in electrical machines.

prerequisites.fi: Students having BSc degree from ELEC: Circuit theory (ELEC-C4110/ELEC-C4120), static and dynamic field theory (ELEC-C4140), or comparable knowledge. Students of Aalto Advanced Energy programme are recommended to take course ELEC-E8422 as prerequisite.
prerequisites.sv: Students having BSc degree from ELEC: Circuit theory (ELEC-C4110/ELEC-C4120), static and dynamic field theory (ELEC-C4140), or comparable knowledge. Students of Aalto Advanced Energy programme are recommended to take course ELEC-E8422 as prerequisite.
prerequisites.en: Students having BSc degree from ELEC: Circuit theory (ELEC-C4110/ELEC-C4120), static and dynamic field theory (ELEC-C4140), or comparable knowledge. Students of Aalto Advanced Energy programme are recommended to take course ELEC-E8422 as prerequisite.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon successful completion of the course, the student will:
1. understand the basics of transmission systems, distribution networks, power system components, electrical safety and high voltage engineering,
2. understand the principles of power and voltage control in the power systems,
3. be able to model power system components,
4. understand the technical limitations and rating factors of both the power system and its components,
5. have a basic understanding of protection and electrical safety.
learningOutcomes.sv: Upon successful completion of the course, the student will: 1. understand the basics of transmission systems, distribution networks, power system components, electrical safety and high voltage engineering, 2. understand the principles of power and voltage control in the power systems, 3. be able to model power system components, 4. understand the technical limitations and rating factors of both the power system and its components, 5. have a basic understanding of protection and electrical safety.

prerequisites.fi: Fundamentals of electrical engineering and electronics.
prerequisites.sv: Fundamentals of electrical engineering and electronics.
prerequisites.en: Fundamentals of electrical engineering and electronics.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of the course, the student:
1. Knows the topologies of the most common switched-mode power supplies and can analyze their operation.
2. Masters the basics of the dynamic modeling and control of SMPS.
3. Knows basics of high frequency inductors and transformers and dimensioning of them as part of SMPS.
learningOutcomes.sv: Upon completion of the course, the student: 1. Knows the topologies of the most common switched-mode power supplies and can analyze their operation. 2. Masters the basics of the dynamic modeling and control of SMPS. 3. Knows basics of high frequency inductors and transformers and dimensioning of them as part of SMPS.
learningOutcomes.en: Upon completion of the course, the student: 1. Knows the topologies of the most common switched-mode power supplies and can analyze their operation. 2. Masters the basics of the dynamic modeling and control of SMPS. 3. Knows basics of high frequency inductors and transformers and dimensioning of them as part of SMPS.

literature.sv: Mohan, Undeland, Robbins: Power Electroncis, Converters, Applications and Design, Wiley&Sons, 3. edition, 2003 and other distributed material.

content.fi: Circuit topologies and operating principles of the most common power supplies based on power electronics. DC-DC converters, resonant topologies, galvanic isolation and isolated topologies such as forward, flyback push-pull, modeling and control of power supplies, diode rectifiers and active power factor correction.

learningOutcomes.fi: At the end of the course the student will be able to: Recognize and use basic lighting laws and theories in calculations Distinguish between lighting quantities, respective units and symbols Recognise the main operational principles of light measurement instruments Operate light measurement instruments Recognize and compare the different type of light sources, their characteristics, performances and operational principles Apply the fundamentals of colorimetry to evaluate lighting installations and light sources Demonstrate the influence of light on vision and visual performance Analyse and differentiate the basic technical aspects of lamps, luminaires and system designing Use lighting design software

learningOutcomes.fi: The purpose of the course is to provide a comprehensive understanding about the factors that affect the reliability of novel electronic products. The emphasis is placed on the fundamentals of electronics integration and packaging, accelerated reliability testing, life-time prediction methods and physics of failure analysis and mechanisms. After the course, the student should have a general understanding on the most common materials, structures, manufacturing methods and failure mechanisms of typical electronic components, packages, modules and devices.

learningOutcomes.fi: Student learns the basics of the working principles of the research and selected reliability and testing methods used in the field of bioadaptive technology. Student understands how these principles can be applied to design portable point-of-care and lab-on-a-chip devices. Concept of translational utilization of the research method principles to develop health and well-being solutions is awakened. Student realizes the process steps that are needed from the first idea of a product to the commercialization of a medical device. Students cultivate both their technical knowhow and personal skills of an engineering expert needed in the work life in the field of bioadaptive technology.

content.fi: Light, atomic force and electron microscopies, optical profilometry, selected atomic and molecular spectroscopy methods, mass spectroscopy, X-ray photoelectron spectroscopies, chromatography, microfluidistics, point-of-care devices, lab-on-a-chips, legislation concerning implantable medical devices, mechanical testing, selected surface characterization methods, adhesion testing, selected surface treatment methods, selected electrochemical research methods, microscale energy production and storage methods, basics of biosensor, microelectrode and actuator technologies. Work life interviews and laboratory exercises.

assesmentMethods.fi:
Continuous evaluation is used on the course. Thus, this course can not be passed by taking only the examination but active participation is demanded: 
Group work (written methods reports, oral method presentations, and the collected educational materials, i.e. usually videos or tutorials), individual students and groups are evaluated

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: ELEC-E550 Speech Processing, ELEC-C5230 Introduction to Signal Processing

prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: ELEC-E550 Speech Processing, ELEC-C5230 Introduction to Signal Processing

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, students can design and implement signal processing -oriented algorithms in speech technology (such as the simple speech codec studied in the course) using Matlab or other signal processing tool. They can also evaluate and document the implemented algorithm.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course, students can design and implement signal processing -oriented algorithms in speech technology (such as the simple speech codec studied in the course) using Matlab or other signal processing tool. They can also evaluate and document the implemented algorithm.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course, students can design and implement signal processing -oriented algorithms in speech technology (such as the simple speech codec studied in the course) using Matlab or other signal processing tool. They can also evaluate and document the implemented algorithm.

content.fi: The goal of the course is to familiarise the student with the design, implementation, evaluation and documentation of a selected signal processing -oriented speech technology algorithm, building a low-bit-rate speech codec. First, an introduction lecture is given to recap the necessary background methodologies which are needed to implement the selected algorithm. Second, by working in teams of 2-3 members, the student conducts the project by progressing through the following steps:(1) The design and the signal processing -based implementation of the speech codec using, e.g., Matlab. (2) The analysis and objective evaluation of the implemented codec. (3) The informal, small-scale subjective evaluation of the implemented codec. (4) The documentation of the entire project. The teams work in the project according to a pre-selected schedule consisting of a few milestones. At each milestone, the progress done is reported to the lecturer in short face-to-face meetings between the team members and the lecturer.

learningOutcomes.fi: Students will be introduced to and trained to use the tools to recognize convex optimization problems that arise in engineering, scince, economics. They will be introduced to the basic theory of such problems, concentrating on results that are useful in computation and engineering and computer science practice. The basic numerical optimization algorithms will be also practiced. Students will also be introduced to basic formats of convex optimization problems that are needed as an input form for convex optimization solvers, such as CVX, and will learn how to use convex optimization tools and existing solvers in their research.

learningOutcomes.fi: After this course you will be familiar with basics of FPGA their architectures, functional properties and uses. You will be familiar how different logic and hardware blocks inside an FPGA communicate. You know how a simple serial interface to a FPGA is implemented and how it operates. You know how the functionality of your FPGA interface code is tested using testbenches.After this course you will understand how to use Verilog hardware description language (HDL) to create logic structures for FPGA. You will know the FPGA development workflow and what components a FPGA HDL tool chain contains. You will know how a Verilog program relates to a FPGA architecture, structure and logic elements.

prerequisites.fi: Ensimmäisen vuoden matematiikankurssit ja todennäköisyyslaskennan perusteet.
prerequisites.sv: Första årets matematikkurser och grunder i sannolikhetsteori.
prerequisites.en: First year math courses and basics in probability theory.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suorittamisen jälkeen opiskelija osaa:
1) tietoverkkojen liikenteen mallintamisen periaatteet eri aikaskaaloissa,
2) soveltaa Markovin prosesseja mallintamaan yksinkertaisten tietoliikennejärjestelmien ja tietokonelaitteistojen liikenneprosessia,
3) analysoida näitä malleja systeemin suorituskyvyn arvioimiseksi, 
4) määritellä ja soveltaa informaatioteorian peruskäsitteitä (entropia, jne.)
5) erotella häviöllistä ja häviötäntä tiedon pakkausta ja kuvata keskeisimpiä pakkausmenetelmiä,
6) laskea yksinkertaisen tietoliikennekanavan kapasiteeti.
learningOutcomes.sv: TBD
learningOutcomes.en: TBD

content.fi: Todennäköisyyslaskennan kertaus. Johdatus stokastisiin prosesseihin ja Poisson-prosessi. Diskreettitilaiset ja jatkuva-aikaiset Markovin prosessit sekä diskreettiaikaiset Markovin ketjut. Liikenteen mallinnus eri aikaskaaloissa ja eri liikennetyypit. Erilaiset jonojärjestelmät ja niiden soveltaminen eri liikennetyyppien suorituskyvyn arvioimiseksi. Informaatioteoria ja sen merkitys informaatioteknologiassa. Entropian muodot sekä kytkentä kanava- ja lähdekoodaukseen. Tiedon pakkauksen perusmenetelmät. Diskreettien, jatkuvien ja monen käyttäjän kanavien kapasiteetit.
content.sv: TBD
content.en: TBD

name.en: Stochastic Models, Estimation and Control D, Lecture

workload.en: Contact teaching, independent studies and work based-learning, examination

prerequisites.fi: Basic knowledge of control engineering and robotics, basic probability theory and statistics.
prerequisites.sv: Basic knowledge of control engineering and robotics, basic probability theory and statistics.
prerequisites.en: Basic knowledge of control engineering and robotics, basic probability theory and statistics.

learningOutcomes.fi: The student understands the main concepts in stochastics, mathematics and main concepts related to estimation and state estimation, the role of uncertainty in dynamic systems and is able to implement state estimation algorithms both in linear and nonlinear case. The student understands what duality between control and estimation means in control engineering and, from this point of view,  the main approaches of stochastic control.
learningOutcomes.sv: The student understands the main concepts in stochastics, mathematics and main concepts related to estimation and state estimation, the role of uncertainty in dynamic systems and is able to implement state estimation algorithms both in linear and nonlinear case. The student understands what duality between control and estimation means in control engineering and, from this point of view,  the main approaches of stochastic control.
learningOutcomes.en: The student understands the main concepts in stochastics, mathematics and main concepts related to estimation and state estimation, the role of uncertainty in dynamic systems and is able to implement state estimation algorithms both in linear and nonlinear case. The student understands what duality between control and estimation means in control engineering and, from this point of view,  the main approaches of stochastic control.

content.fi: Basics of statistics and stochastic processes. Basic concepts in estimation, ML, MAP, LS, MMSE; unbiased estimators. Linear estimation in static systems. Optimal state estimation in discrete linear dynamic systems, Kalman filter and information filter. Optimal State estimation in nonlinear dynamic systems, recursive functional relationship. Approximation of optimal nonlinear state estimation, particle filter, extended Kalman filters, 1st and 2nd order. Adaptive estimation. Duality of estimation and control. Main approaches in stochastic control.
content.sv: Basics of statistics and stochastic processes. Basic concepts in estimation, ML, MAP, LS, MMSE; unbiased estimators. Linear estimation in static systems. Optimal state estimation in discrete linear dynamic systems, Kalman filter and information filter. Optimal State estimation in nonlinear dynamic systems, recursive functional relationship. Approximation of optimal nonlinear state estimation, particle filter, extended Kalman filters, 1st and 2nd order. Adaptive estimation. Duality of estimation and control. Main approaches in stochastic control.
content.en: Basics of statistics and stochastic processes. Basic concepts in estimation, ML, MAP, LS, MMSE; unbiased estimators. Linear estimation in static systems. Optimal state estimation in discrete linear dynamic systems, Kalman filter and information filter. Optimal State estimation in nonlinear dynamic systems, recursive functional relationship. Approximation of optimal nonlinear state estimation, particle filter, extended Kalman filters, 1st and 2nd order. Adaptive estimation. Duality of estimation and control. Main approaches in stochastic control.

workload.fi:
Lectures cover the main content of the course. In addition, the mapping the forest is illustrated in a small LiDAR 3D-point-cloud -project and the automatic driving in forest  is illustrated in a small Polaris eATV-project. Both projects are done in the teams of four students.
Contact teaching, independent studies and the two projects, examination
Compulsory attendance 3

Forest machines are becoming semiautonomous, with modern machine perception and methods of probabilistic robotics and modern control, the efficiency, economy, quality and operability of forest harvesting can be improved. With the same machine perception  the machine are also becoming producers of forest big data, also conservation of valuable nature forest areas and biodiversity can be quaranteed and documented. 
Some lectures will given in the forest faculties of HY  and UEF.

Some lectures will given in the forest faculties of HY  and UEF.
learningOutcomes.en:
Forest machines are becoming semiautonomous, with modern machine perception and methods of probabilistic robotics and modern control, the efficiency, economy, quality and operability of forest harvesting can be improved. With the same machine perception  the machine are also becoming producers of forest big data, also conservation of valuable nature forest areas and biodiversity can be quaranteed and documented. 
Some lectures will given in the forest faculties of HY  and UEF.

content.fi: Nordic Cut-to-Lenght forest harvesting and Silviculture; kinematic models of harvester and forwarder; machine vision,  LiDARs and SLAM in forest, creating map of trees (Forestrix-project); machine vision based quality measurements ( Metrix&MetrixPro); automated silviculture of young forests (NeoSilvix), Augmented reality HMIs (COMBAT); positioning in forest, use of drones in forestry, semiautonomous forwarder (Autologger), MPC in the automatic driving in forests.

content.en: Nordic Cut-to-Lenght forest harvesting and Silviculture; kinematic models of harvester and forwarder; machine vision,  LiDARs and SLAM in forest, creating map of trees (Forestrix-project); machine vision based quality measurements ( Metrix&MetrixPro); automated silviculture of young forests (NeoSilvix), Augmented reality HMIs (COMBAT); positioning in forest, use of drones in forestry, semiautonomous forwarder (Autologger), MPC in the automatic driving in forests.

name.en: Entrepreneurship as a tool of an engineer, Lecture

workload.fi: Etäopetus, itsenäinen työskentely ja/tai ryhmätyöskentely.
workload.sv:
Distansundervisning
Självständigt och/eller grupparbete
workload.en:
Online teaching
Independent work and / or Group Work

prerequisites.fi: ei
prerequisites.sv: nej
prerequisites.en: no

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin tavoitteena on kehittää opiskelijan ymmärrystä yrittäjyystaidoista.  Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija: 
  • ymmärtää perusteet yrittäjähenkisestä ajattelusta sekä yrittäjyystaidoista 
  • pystyy kertomaan miksi insinöörit tarvitsevat yrittäjähenkistä ajattelua
learningOutcomes.sv:
Kursens syfte är att utveckla den studerandes förståelse för entreprenöriell kompetens  Efter kursen
  • förstår den studerande grunderna i entreprenörsanda och entreprenöriell kompetens 
  • kan den studenrande förklara varför ingenjörer behöver entreprenörsanda
learningOutcomes.en:
The goal of the course is to develop the understanding entrepreneurial skills.  After the course, the student: 
  • understands basics of entrepreneurship mindset and entrepreneurial skills 
  • Is able to explain why engineers need entrepreneurial mindset

content.fi:
Yrittäjähenkinen ajattelu ja yrittäjyystaidot ovat hyödyllisiä ja tarpeen kaikenlaisissa organisaatioissa. Tämän kurssin tarkoituksena ei ole auttaa opiskelijoita perustamaan omaa yritystä, vaan valjastaa heidät yrittäjähenkisellä ajattelulla, jota he voivat hyödyntää missä vain elämäntilanteessa. 
Yrittäjyystaidot voidaan jakaa kolmeen osa-alueeseen ideoihin ja mahdollisuuksiin, resursseihin, sekä toiminnan aloittamiseen. Näiden sisällä on useita erilaisia taitoja sekä ajatusmalleja joita voi hyödyntää erilaisissa toimissa. Näitä ovat esimerkiksi: yhteistyö eri tahojen kanssa, mahdollisuuksien etsiminen ja tunnistaminen, sekä tulostenviestintä. 
Kurssilla tarkastellaan sekä harjoitellaan yrittäjyystaitoja sekä yrittäjähenkistä ajattelua ja reflektoidaan näitä suhteessa omaan tulevaisuuteen.
content.sv:
Entreprenörsanda och entreprenöriell kompetens är fördelaktigt och behövs i alla typer av organisationer. Målet med kursen är inte att hjälpa studerande att starta egna företag, utan snarare att utrusta dem med entreprenörsanda, som de kan använda i alla livssituationer. 
Entreprenöriell kompetens kan delas in i tre undergrupper: idéer och möjligheter, resurser och att skrida till handling. Inom dessa undergrupper finns många olika färdigheter och sätt att tänka, som kan användas i olika verksamheter. Exempel på sådana färdigheter och tänkesätt är: samarbete med andra yrkesverksamma, att söka och identifiera möjligheter, samt att kommunicera resultat. 
I kursen får den studerande undersöka och öva på entreprenöriell kompetens och entreprenörsanda samt reflektera över dessa i relation till sin egen framtid.
content.en:
Entrepreneurial mindset and entrepreneurial skills are beneficial and needed in all kinds of organizations. The aim of the course is not to help students to start their own business, but rather to equip them with entrepreneurial mindset, that they could use in any life situation. 
Entrepreneurial skills can be divided into three subgroups, ideas & opportunities, resources, and into action. Inside  these subgroups, there are many different skills and ways of thinking, that can be utilized in various operations. Some of these skills and ways of thinking are for example: collaboration with other professionals, seeking and identifying opportunities, and communication of results. 
The course focuses inspecting and practicing entrepreneurial skills and entrepreneurial mindset, and reflecting these in relation to their own future.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Lukion fysiikan kurssit FY1, FY4, FY5 (OPS 2019).
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Gymnasiekurser i fysik FY1, FY4, FY5 (OPS 2019)
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Finnish high school physics courses FY1, FY4, FY5 (OPS 2019).

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija on kerrannut lukion fysiikan klassista mekaniikkaa käsittelevät kurssit sekä harjoitellut näihin kursseihin liittyviä laskutehtäviä ja laskurutiinia. Opiskelija on valmis osallistumaan kurssille ELEC-A9110 Klassinen fysiikka tai vastaaville yliopistotasoisille fysiikan peruskursseille.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter slutförd kurs har du repeterat gymnasiets kurser i fysik som behandlar klassisk mekanik. Du har gjort räkneövningar samt övat din räknerutin. Du är beredd att ta grundkurser i fysik på universitetsnivå, t.ex. ELEC-A9110 Klassisk fysik eller motsvarande kurser.
learningOutcomes.en: Having completed this preparatory course, you have gone through the high school courses that discuss classical mechanics and practised related exercises and learnt working routines. You are now ready to take university-level physics basic courses, such as ELEC-A9110 Classical physics.

content.fi:
Lukion fysiikan kurssit (OPS 2019)
  • FY1 (Fysiikka luonnontieteenä)
  • FY4 (Voima ja liike)
  • FY5 (Jaksollinen liike ja aallot)
content.sv:
Gymnasiets kurser i fysik (läroplan 2019)
  • FY1 (Fysiken som naturvetenskap)
  • FY4 (Kraft och rörelse)
  • FY5 (Periodisk rörelse och vågor)
content.en:
High school physics courses (naming according the curriculum 2019)
  • FY1 (Physics as a natural science)
  • FY4 (Force and motion)
  • FY5 (Periodic motion and waves)

assesmentMethods.en: Passing the course requires completing a sufficient amount of online homework.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Basic courses in mathematics on the BSc level. Familiarity with MATLAB/Mathematica is beneficial.

learningOutcomes.fi: This course refreshes students' basic mathematical skills and develops software and programming competencies that are needed in studies for Master's degree. The contents include topics e.g. data analysis, mathematical transforms, matrix operations and differential equations. Exercises are solved using MATLAB and/or Mathematica, which supports the learning of these widely used programming platforms.

Exercises are solved using MATLAB and/or Mathematica, which supports the learning of these widely used programming platforms.
learningOutcomes.en: This course refreshes students' basic mathematical skills and develops software and programming competencies that are needed in studies for Master's degree. The contents include topics e.g. data analysis, mathematical transforms, matrix operations and differential equations. Exercises are solved using MATLAB and/or Mathematica, which supports the learning of these widely used programming platforms.

content.fi:
This course addresses analysis and modelling of mathematical problems in the fields of physics and engineering. Lectures focus on the theoretical backgrounds of studied problems and exercises on their computational solution methods. MATLAB and Mathematica are the main software platforms used for numeric modelling of the given problems. 
Course consists of topics including: data analysis, symbolic and numeric approaches for solving physics and engineering problems, mathematical transforms, differential and integral equations, systems of differential equation, and numerical methods on differential equations. Contents may vary slightly every year.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Knowledge
After completing the course, the students will be able to explain in concrete detail what is needed for creating a functioning IoT prototype including hardware, embedded software, and network-based service. The students will be able to identify the key challenges related to embedded software development in the IoT context. 
Experience
After completing the course, the students will have an experience of an IoT concept design project from contextual study to hand-over of a design concept. They will also have experience in working in varying multidisciplinary teams in different roles in negotiating and describing technically oriented requirements.
Skills
After completing the course, the students will be able to plan and execute a multi-disciplinary concept design process for IoT products. They are able to evaluate also technical content of a requirements proposal.

prerequisites.en: Basic knowledge about Unix operating systems and Pythom programmin is useful

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija
-Osaa työskennellä sujuvasti Unix käyttöjärjestelmäympäristössä -Osaa Unix komentokielien perusteet -Osaa versionhallinnan perusteet -Osaa mallintaa yksinkertaisia digitaalisia, usein signaalinkäsittelyyn liittyviä, järjestelmiä Python-kielellä -Ymmärtää yksinkertaisten laitteistokuvauskielisten kuvausten periaatteet. -Osaa toteuttaa yksinkertaisia digitaalisia järjestelmiä FPGA alustalla.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen kan studenten
- arbeta smidigt med Unix-operativsystemet
- använda grundkommandon för Unix
- grunderna i versionshantering
- modellera enkla, digitala, ofta till signalbehandling relaterade, system på Python programspråk
- förstå principer för enkla beskrivningar på hårdvarubeskrivande språk
- genomföra enkla digitala system på FPGA-plattformen
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course a student
- can work fluently in Unix operating system environment
- knows basics of Unix scripting language
- knows basics of version control
- can model simple systems, commonly involved in signal processing, by Python
- understands principles of simple hardware markup language descriptions
- can implement simple digital systems by using FPGAs

content.fi: Tulevaisuuden elektroniikkasuunnittelijan on ymmärrettävä laitteisto-ohjelmistorajapinta ja laitteiston ohjelmistoille aiheuttamat rajoitukset. Myös suunnittelumetodiikka edellyttää hyvää ohjelmoinnin perusosaamista, sillä elektroniikkasuunnittelusssa hyödynnetään laajasti ohjelmointia. Kurssissa tutustutaan elektronisen laitteen suunnitteluprosessiin siten, että laitteiston mallintaminen, simulointi ja lopulta ohjaus- sekä käyttöliittymä  yhdistetään yhdeksi ohjelmalliseksi kokonaisuuudeksi. Kurssilla opiskelijan ohjelmointitaitoja kehitetään laitteistosuunnittelua tukevaan suuntaan ja hänet tutustutetaan tehokkaisiin ohjelmistollisiiin työtapoihin elektroniikkasuunnittelun näkökulmasta. Kurssilla perehdytään tyypillisiin ohjelmallisiin suunnitteluympäristöihin ja käydään läpi ohjelmallisen laitteistosuunnittelun eri vaiheet mallintamisesta toteutukseen. Kurssi tarjoaa opiskelijalle erinomaisen lähtökohdan kehitttää ohjelmointi- ja laitteistosuunnitteluosaamistaan eteepäin myöhemmissä opintojen vaiheissa.
content.sv:
Framtidens planerare inom elektronik måste förstå gränssnitten för hårdvara och programvara samt de begräsningar som hårdvaran uppställer för programvaror. Även planeringsmetodiken förutsätter bra grundkunskaper i programmering eftersom man utnyttjar dessa kunskaper omfattande i planeringen inom elektronik. På kursen bekantar man sig med planeringsprocessen av en elektronisk apparat så att apparaturens modellering, simulering och slutligen styr- och operativsystem sammanfogas till en helhet.
På kursen utvecklar studenten sina kunskaper i programmering till en riktning som stöder planeringen av apparaturer. Studenten bekantar sig även med effektiva arbetssätt ur elektronikplaneringens synvinkel. På kursen sätter man sig in i typiska omgivningar för planeringen av programvaror och genomgår olika faser i planeringen av apparaturer från modelleringen till förverkligandet. Kursen erbjuder en utmärkt utgångspunkt åt studenten att utveckla sin kompetens i programmering och planering av apparaturer vidare i senare skeden av studierna.
content.en:
In future an electronics designer must have an understanding of a hardware-software interface and of restrictions a hardware can cause for softwares. Also a design methodology requires a good basic knowledge in programming, as programming is widely utilized in electronics design. On the course one becomes acquainted with a design process of an electronic device in a way, where modelling, simulation and finally controlling and operating system are connected to be one programmatic ensemble.
On the course a student develops his/her programming skills in a way which promotes hardware design and the course familiarizes the student with the powerful prorgammatic methods from an electronics design perspective. The course familiarizes the student with typical designing environments and different stages of the programmatic harware design from the modelling to the implementation are went through. The course provides to students an excellent starting point to improve their know-how in programming and in hardware design in their further studies.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, the student should be able to apply and use the substance knowledge of his/her studies in a real-life problem solving. They should be able to successfully participate in a multi-disciplinary project team that creates a demo or a prototype of a product, service or other innovation, using agile development practices, design and product research methods. They should be able to write a project report that summarizes, conceptualizes, and explains the findings and ideas developed during a project as well as deliver related oral presentations.

content.fi: Demola (https://www.demola.net/) project work is a project course organized in collaboration with various industrial and academic partners. The project enables students to work in strategic foresight projects in multi-disciplinary teams. The project lasts rouhgly for two months and is organized according to a schedule, which is different from the Aalto periodic structure. The project involves foresight work, problem framing, concept development, demo building, and end-user validation. The course contributes to learning work-life skills as well as supports students to network with potential future partners / employers.

learningOutcomes.fi: The student understands fundamental acoustic concepts and can interpret the wave equation and its solution under different conditions. The student also understands the behavior of simple vibrational and acoustical systems and is able to apply analogies between the mechanical (acoustical) and electrical domains. The student can analyze the wave propagation and sound radiation of simple sound sources. The student can use multiphysics modeling software to solve certain acoustical problems.
learningOutcomes.sv: The student understands fundamental acoustic concepts and can interpret the wave equation and its solution under different conditions. The student also understands the behavior of simple vibrational and acoustical systems and is able to apply analogies between the mechanical (acoustical) and electrical domains. The student can analyze the wave propagation and sound radiation of simple sound sources. The student can use multiphysics modeling software to solve certain acoustical problems.

The student can analyze the wave propagation and sound radiation of simple sound sources. The student can use multiphysics modeling software to solve certain acoustical problems.

content.fi: Oscillations in simple systems, strings, membranes and room volumes. Propagation, diffraction, transmission and reflection of sound waves. Acoustical transmission lines, ducts and horns. Impedance and acoustic equivalent circuits. Basics of finite element modeling.
content.sv: Oscillations in simple systems, strings, membranes and room volumes. Propagation, diffraction, transmission and reflection of sound waves. Acoustical transmission lines, ducts and horns. Impedance and acoustic equivalent circuits. Basics of finite element modeling.
content.en: Oscillations in simple systems, strings, membranes and room volumes. Propagation, diffraction, transmission and reflection of sound waves. Acoustical transmission lines, ducts and horns. Impedance and acoustic equivalent circuits. Basics of finite element modeling.

learningOutcomes.fi: Students will be able to describe the history, trends, and applications of digital audio signal processing, recognize and design digital filters used in audio signal processing, describe how the sampling rate of a digital audio signal can be altered, list sound analysis, synthesis, and effects processing techniques and their main features, explain basic principles and uses of audio codecs, describe what the concept "virtual acoustics" means, and apply the provided methods using the MATLAB software.
learningOutcomes.sv: Students will be able to describe the history, trends, and applications of digital audio signal processing, recognize and design digital filters used in audio signal processing, describe how the sampling rate of a digital audio signal can be altered, list sound analysis, synthesis, and effects processing techniques and their main features, explain basic principles and uses of audio codecs, describe what the concept "virtual acoustics" means, and apply the provided methods using the MATLAB software.
learningOutcomes.en: Students will be able to describe the history, trends, and applications of digital audio signal processing, recognize and design digital filters used in audio signal processing, describe how the sampling rate of a digital audio signal can be altered, list sound analysis, synthesis, and effects processing techniques and their main features, explain basic principles and uses of audio codecs, describe what the concept "virtual acoustics" means, and apply the provided methods using the MATLAB software.

content.fi: General overview, history, and applications of audio signal processing, digital filters used in audio, audio-specific design methods for digital filters, sampling rate conversion, analysis methods for audio signals, digital reverberation and effects, 3-D sound and virtual acoustics, sound synthesis, and audio coding standards.
content.sv: General overview, history, and applications of audio signal processing, digital filters used in audio, audio-specific design methods for digital filters, sampling rate conversion, analysis methods for audio signals, digital reverberation and effects, 3-D sound and virtual acoustics, sound synthesis, and audio coding standards.
content.en: General overview, history, and applications of audio signal processing, digital filters used in audio, audio-specific design methods for digital filters, sampling rate conversion, analysis methods for audio signals, digital reverberation and effects, 3-D sound and virtual acoustics, sound synthesis, and audio coding standards.

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Understanding of electrical, mechanical and acoustical systems and the relationships between them.
  • Identification and modelling of electroacoustic systems through the use of impedance analogies.
  • Exposure to finite element modelling packages currently used for designing electroacoustic products.
  • Teamwork and presentation skills as well the ability to support and argue design choices.
learningOutcomes.sv:
• Understanding of electrical, mechanical and acoustical systems and the relationships between them.
  • Identification and modelling of electroacoustic systems through the use of impedance analogies.
  • Exposure to finite element modelling packages currently used for designing electroacoustic products.
  • Teamwork and presentation skills as well the ability to support and argue design choices.
learningOutcomes.en:
• Understanding of electrical, mechanical and acoustical systems and the relationships between them.
  • Identification and modelling of electroacoustic systems through the use of impedance analogies.
  • Exposure to finite element modelling packages currently used for designing electroacoustic products.
  • Teamwork and presentation skills as well the ability to support and argue design choices.

learningOutcomes.fi: Students learn to carry out a project in the field of acoustics and audio technology autonomously and/or as members of team. They learn to plan a project, estimate and schedule work load, time consumption and other resources, and take responsibility of their schedule and deliveries. They learn to apply their theoretical knowledge to real life problems, and also understand the need for simplifications and trade-offs. They learn to report, present and argue their presumptions, solutions and results. They learn entrepreneur skills and reflection skills.

They learn to apply their theoretical knowledge to real life problems, and also understand the need for simplifications and trade-offs. They learn to report, present and argue their presumptions, solutions and results. They learn entrepreneur skills and reflection skills.

They learn to report, present and argue their presumptions, solutions and results. They learn entrepreneur skills and reflection skills.

content.fi: Design of FIR filters and multirate filters, and necessary pieces of detection and estimation theory applied to compensation of frequency offset, carrier phase synchronization, symbol timing synchronization, automatic gain control, analog-to-digital conversion, spectrum analysis. The theoretical concepts are verified by implementing the receiver algorithms using software-defined radio and receiving real signals.
content.sv: Design of FIR filters and multirate filters, and necessary pieces of detection and estimation theory applied to compensation of frequency offset, carrier phase synchronization, symbol timing synchronization, automatic gain control, analog-to-digital conversion, spectrum analysis. The theoretical concepts are verified by implementing the receiver algorithms using software-defined radio and receiving real signals.
content.en: Design of FIR filters and multirate filters, and necessary pieces of detection and estimation theory applied to compensation of frequency offset, carrier phase synchronization, symbol timing synchronization, automatic gain control, analog-to-digital conversion, spectrum analysis. The theoretical concepts are verified by implementing the receiver algorithms using software-defined radio and receiving real signals.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Tekninen sisältö
  • Puheen mallinnuksen perusteiden ymmärtäminen
  • Tietoisuus puheenkäsittelyn ongelma-alojen jaottelusta
  • Kyky löytää ja käyttää puheenkäsittelyn ennalta tehtyjä malleja ja datasettejä
  • Kyky muokata ja treenata puheenkäsittelyn neuraalimalleja
  • Omaa kokemusta puheenkäsittelyn menetelmien objektiivisesta evaluoinnista ja tulosten tilastollisesta analyysistä
Inhimilliset ja yhteiskunnalliset aspektit
  • Puheentuoton, lingvistiikan ja puheilmaisun perusteiden ymmärtäminen
  • Tietoisuus monimuotoisuuden, syrjinnän, yksityisyyden ja kestävyyden vaikutuksista ja ongelmista puheenkäsittelyssä
  • Kokemusta subjektiivisesta evaluoinnista ja tietoa menetelmien rajoitukisista niiden suunnittelussa
learningOutcomes.sv:
Tekniskt innehåll
  • Förståelse om och erfarenhet av grunderna i talmodellering
  • Kunskaper i huvudområden för talbehandling
  • Förmåga att hitta och använda förtränade modeller och dataset för talbehandling
  • Förmåga att modifiera och träna neurala modeller för talbehandling
  • Erfarenhet av objektiv utvärdering av talbehandling inklusive relaterad statistisk analys
Mänskliga och samhälleliga aspekter
  • Förståelse för grunderna i talproduktion, lingvistik och taluttryck
  • Medvetenhet om frågor om mångfald, diskriminering, integritet och hållbarhet i talbehandling
  • Erfarenhet av subjektiv värdering och kunskap om metodernas begränsningar
learningOutcomes.en:
Technical content
  • Understanding of and experience in the basics of speech modeling
  • Knowledge of main areas of speech processing
  • Ability to find and use pre-trained models and datasets for speech processing
  • Ability to modify and train neural models for speech processing
  • Experience with objective evaluation of speech processing including related statistical analysis
Human and societal aspects
  • Understanding of basics of speech production, linguistics, and speech expression
  • Awareness of issues of diversity, discrimination, privacy, and sustainability in speech processing
  • Experience with subjective evaluation and knowledge of their design constraints

content.fi:
• Järjestelmärakenteet ja sovellusalueet
  • Digitaalisen puhenkäsittelyn perusteet, mukaan lukien lyhytaikainen spektrianalyysi ja -käsittely, verhokäyrämallit, perustaajuus, lineaarinen ennustava koodaus, mel-taajuus kepstrikertoimet
  • Esikäsittelymenetelmien perusteet, mukaan lukien puheaktiivisuuden tunnistus ja puheen ehostaminen
  • Puheenkäsittelysovellukset, mukaan lukien puheen koodaus, puheen ehostus, puhujan muuntaminen ja tunnistaminen
  • Laadun arviointi objektiivisilla ja subjektiivisilla menetelmillä sekä tulosten tilastollisensanalyysin perusteet
  • Koneoppiminen puheenkäsittelyssä, mukaan lukien äänen ja datasettien käsittely, esikoulutettujen mallien etsiminen ja käyttäminen, omien mallien rakentaminen, yleinen työnkulku
content.sv:
• Systemstrukturer och applikationsområden
  • Grundläggande digital talbehandling, inklusive korttidsanalys och -bearbetning av spektra, enveloppmodeller, grund frekvens, linjär prediktiv kodning, mel-frekvens cepstralkoefficienter
  • Grundläggande förbearbetningsmetoder, inklusive upptäckt av röstaktivitet och talförbättring
  • Talbehandlingsapplikationer, inklusive talkodning, talförbättring, röstkonvertering och talaridentifiering
  • Kvalitetsutvärdering med objektiva och subjektiva metoder samt grundläggande statistisk analys av resultat
  • Maskininlärning för tal, inklusive arbete med ljud och datauppsättningar, hitta och använda förtränade modeller, bygga egna modeller, arbetsflöde
content.en:
• Systems structures and application areas
  • Basic digital speech processing, including short-time spectral analysis and processing, envelope models, fundamental frequency, linear predictive coding, mel-frequency cepstral coefficients
  • Fundamental pre-processing methods, including voice activity detection and speech enhancement
  • Speech processing applications, including speech coding, speech enhancement, voice conversion, and speaker identification
  • Quality evaluation using objective and subjective methods, and basic statistical analysis of results
  • Machine learning for speech, including working with audio and datasets, finding and using pre-trained models, building own models, overall workflow

learningOutcomes.fi: After attending the course, the student knows how statistical and adaptive methods are used in information retrieval, machine translation, text mining, speech processing and related areas to process natural language contents. Furthermore, the student can apply the basic methods and techniques used for statistical natural language modeling including, for instance, clustering, classification, Hidden markov models and Bayesian models.

Furthermore, the student can apply the basic methods and techniques used for statistical natural language modeling including, for instance, clustering, classification, Hidden markov models and Bayesian models.

literature.en: C. Manning, H. Schütze, 1999. Foundations of Statistical Natural Language Processing. The MIT Press; Lecture notes.
literature.fi: C. Manning, H. Schütze, 1999. Foundations of Statistical Natural Language Processing. The MIT Press; Lecture notes.
literature.sv: C. Manning, H. Schütze, 1999. Foundations of Statistical Natural Language Processing. The MIT Press; Lecture notes.

content.fi: Many core applications in modern information society such as search engines, social media, machine translation, speech processing and text mining for business intelligence apply statistical and adaptive methods. This course provides information on these methods and teaches basic skills on how they are applied on natural language data. Each topic is handled by a high level expert in the area.

learningOutcomes.fi: After attending the course, the student knows how statistical and adaptive methods are used in information retrieval, machine translation, text mining, speech processing and related areas to process natural language contents. Furthermore, the student can apply the basic methods and techniques used for statistical natural language modeling including, for instance, clustering, classification, Hidden markov models and Bayesian models.

content.fi: Many core applications in modern information society such as search engines, social media, machine translation, speech processing and text mining for business intelligence apply statistical and adaptive methods. This course provides information on these methods and teaches basic skills on how they are applied on natural language data. Each topic is handled by a high level expert in the area.

learningOutcomes.fi: The student understands basic acoustical measurements and can perform measurements with standard techniques. The student is also familiar with more advanced techniques and is well aware of limitations and problems in measurements. Moreover, the student can interpret the results and understands the uncertainties of different measurement techniques.
learningOutcomes.sv: The student understands basic acoustical measurements and can perform measurements with standard techniques. The student is also familiar with more advanced techniques and is well aware of limitations and problems in measurements. Moreover, the student can interpret the results and understands the uncertainties of different measurement techniques.
learningOutcomes.en: The student understands basic acoustical measurements and can perform measurements with standard techniques. The student is also familiar with more advanced techniques and is well aware of limitations and problems in measurements. Moreover, the student can interpret the results and understands the uncertainties of different measurement techniques.

content.fi: Acoustical measurement techniques in theory and in practice. The main emphasis is in measurements related to room and building acoustics, but also environmental noise measurements are covered. The use of standard measuring equipment is introduced also in theory and in practice. The course include special assignments and some measurement demonstrations during the lectures.

learningOutcomes.fi: Opit ymmärtämään informaatiojärjestelmien ja -palveluiden keskeisimmät käsitteet, tavoitteet ja toimintaperiaatteet. Opit hallitsemaan muutamien tärkeimpien matemaattisten mallien perusteet ja opit soveltamaan niitä yksinkertaisiin käytännön ongelmiin. Kehität itsellesi näkemyksen tietotekniikan, tietoverkkojen ja palveluiden muodostamasta monimutkaisesta kokonaisuudesta ja sen eri osien merkityksestä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Den studerande lär sig förstå de centrala begreppen, målen och principerna i informationssystem och -service. Den studerande lär sig behärska grunderna i några av de viktigaste matematiska modellerna och att använda dessa för att lösa enkla, praktiska problem. Dessutom får den studerande insikt i de komplicerade system som utformar informations- och kommunikationssystem och -service, samt de olika delarnas betydelse i dessa.
learningOutcomes.en: The student should learn the fundamental concepts, objectives, and principles of information systems and services. After the course, the student shall be able to master some simple but useful mathematical models and be able to apply them to solving practical problems. Finally, the student should develop general insight in the complex system consisting of various information and communications technologies and services.

content.fi: Osa 1: Tieto- ja tietoliikennetekniikan perusteet1) Informaatioteknologian kehityskulku 2) Tietokoneen rakenne ja toiminta3) Käyttöjärjestelmät ja virtualisointi4) Tiedonsiirron perusteet5) Tilakoneet ja tietoliikenneprotokollat6) Keskeisimmän tietoverkot7) InternetOsa 2: Data analyysin perusteet8) Näytteenotto ja digitaalinen signaalinkäsittely9) Koneoppiminen ja tekoäly10) Äänen ja puheen käsittely Osa 3: Tieto- ja tietoliikennetekniikan yhteiskunnalliset vaikutukset11) Energian kulutus ja hiilidioksidipäästöt12) Digitaalinen murros
content.sv:
Del 1: Grunderna i informations- och kommunikationsteknik1) Utvecklingen av informationsteknologi2) Datororganisation och arkitektur3) Operativsystem och virtualisering4) Grunderna i tekniska överföringsmetoder5) Statsmaskiner och kommunikationsprotokoll6) De viktigaste informationsnätverken7) Internet
Del 2: Grunderna i dataanalys8) Sampling och digital signalbehandling9) Maskininlärning och artificiell intelligens10) Ljud- och talbehandling
Del 3: De samhälleliga konsekvenserna av informations- och kommunikationsteknik11) Energiförbrukning och CO2-utsläpp12) Den digitala transformationen
content.en: Part 1: Fundamentals of information and communication technology1) The development of information technology2) Computer organization and architecture3) Operating systems and virtualization4) Basics of transmission methods5) State machines and communication protocols6) The most important information networks7) InternetPart 2: Basics of Data Analysis8) Sampling and basics of digital signal processing9) Machine learning and artificial intelligence10) Audio and speech processingPart 3: The societal implications of information and communication technologies11) Energy consumption and CO2 emissions12) The digital transformation

learningOutcomes.fi: Opit ymmärtämään informaatiojärjestelmien ja -palveluiden keskeisimmät käsitteet, tavoitteet ja toimintaperiaatteet. Opit hallitsemaan muutamien tärkeimpien matemaattisten mallien perusteet ja opit soveltamaan niitä yksinkertaisiin käytännön ongelmiin. Kehität itsellesi näkemyksen tietotekniikan, tietoverkkojen ja palveluiden muodostamasta monimutkaisesta kokonaisuudesta ja sen eri osien merkityksestä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Den studerande lär sig förstå de centrala begreppen, målen och principerna i informationssystem och -service. Den studerande lär sig behärska grunderna i några av de viktigaste matematiska modellerna och att använda dessa för att lösa enkla, praktiska problem. Dessutom får den studerande insikt i de komplicerade system som utformar informations- och kommunikationssystem och -service, samt de olika delarnas betydelse i dessa.
learningOutcomes.en: The student should learn the fundamental concepts, objectives, and principles of information systems and services. After the course, the student shall be able to master some simple but useful mathematical models and be able to apply them to solving practical problems. Finally, the student should develop general insight in the complex system consisting of various information and communications technologies and services.

content.fi: Osa 1: Tieto- ja tietoliikennetekniikan perusteet1) Informaatioteknologian kehityskulku 2) Tietokoneen rakenne ja toiminta3) Käyttöjärjestelmät ja virtualisointi4) Tiedonsiirron perusteet5) Tilakoneet ja tietoliikenneprotokollat6) Keskeisimmän tietoverkot7) InternetOsa 2: Data analyysin perusteet8) Näytteenotto ja digitaalinen signaalinkäsittely9) Koneoppiminen ja tekoäly10) Äänen ja puheen käsittely Osa 3: Tieto- ja tietoliikennetekniikan yhteiskunnalliset vaikutukset11) Energian kulutus ja hiilidioksidipäästöt12) Digitaalinen murros
content.sv:
Del 1: Grunderna i informations- och kommunikationsteknik1) Utvecklingen av informationsteknologi2) Datororganisation och arkitektur3) Operativsystem och virtualisering4) Grunderna i tekniska överföringsmetoder5) Statsmaskiner och kommunikationsprotokoll6) De viktigaste informationsnätverken7) Internet
Del 2: Grunderna i dataanalys8) Sampling och digital signalbehandling9) Maskininlärning och artificiell intelligens10) Ljud- och talbehandling
Del 3: De samhälleliga konsekvenserna av informations- och kommunikationsteknik11) Energiförbrukning och CO2-utsläpp12) Den digitala transformationen
content.en: Part 1: Fundamentals of information and communication technology1) The development of information technology2) Computer organization and architecture3) Operating systems and virtualization4) Basics of transmission methods5) State machines and communication protocols6) The most important information networks7) InternetPart 2: Basics of Data Analysis8) Sampling and basics of digital signal processing9) Machine learning and artificial intelligence10) Audio and speech processingPart 3: The societal implications of information and communication technologies11) Energy consumption and CO2 emissions12) The digital transformation

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: C-ohjelmoinnin peruskurssi.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Grundkurs i C-programmering.
prerequisites.en: Suositellut esitiedot: C-ohjelmoinnin peruskurssi.

learningOutcomes.fi: Omaksut taidot suunnitella ja toteuttaa sovelluksia C-kielellä. Tunnet POSIX ohjelmointirajapinnan mahdollisuudet ja rajoitukset ja osaat soveltaa sitä sovellusten tuottamisessa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Den studerande får färdigheter i att planera och förverkliga applikationer med C-programmeringsspråket. Den studerande lär sig känna till POSIX-programmeringsgränssnittets möjligheter och begränsningar och kan använda det i praktiken.
learningOutcomes.en: The student should learn the skills to design and implement applications in C programming language. This consists of knowledge of possibilities and limitations of POSIX application programming interface and the ability to apply it in practice.

content.fi: POSIX/UNIX03 ohjelmointirajapinnat, muun muassa tiedostojen käsittely, siirrännän multipleksointi, signaalit, prosessien välinen viestintä (IPC), rinnakkainen ohjelmointi ja säikeet.
content.sv: POSIX/UNIX03 programmerinsgränssnitten för bl.a. filbehandling, input/output multiplexering, signaler, kommunikation mellan processer (IPC), parallell programmering och trådar.
content.en: POSIX/UNIX03 application programming interfaces, including file access, input/output multiplexing, signals, interprocess communication (IPC), concurrent programming and threads.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: ELEC-A7200 (suositellaan myös ELEC-C7230)
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: ELEC-A7200 (även ELEC-C7230 rekommenderas)
prerequisites.en: Suositellut esitiedot: ELEC-A7200 (suositellaan myös ELEC-C7230)

learningOutcomes.fi:
Tunnet lähettimen ja vastaanottimen eri lohkojen toiminnat ja mahdolliset tietoliikennejärjestelmässä esiintyvät virhelähteet.
Ymmärrät ohjelmistoprojektin rakenteen ja pystyt osallistumaan ohjelmistoprojektiin, jossa on monta osapuolta. Tunnet systemaattisia ongelmaratkaisumalleja ja pystyt soveltaman niitä omissa projekteissasi.
Ymmärrät interferenssikäsitteen radiojärjestelmissä ja pystyt arvioimaan interferenssin vaikutusta radiolinkkeihin ja radioverkoihin.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Den studerande lär sig känna till de olika blocken i en radiomottagare och -sändare, samt hur en mottagare i praktiken skiljer sig från de teoretiska modellerna. Den studerande lär sig modellering av en icke-ideal mottagare/sändare och att mäta felen som uppstår av dessa.
Den studerande förstår strukturen av ett mjukvaruprojekt och kan delta i ett stort mjukvaruprojekt med flera programmerare. Dessutom lär sig den studerande grunderna i problemlösningsmetoder och hur dessa kan tillämpas i egna projekt.
Den studerande förstår vad interferens är och kan uppskatta hur interferensen påverkar radiolänkar och radiokommunikationssystem i allmänhet.
learningOutcomes.en:
After this course, you know how a radio transceiver is constructed. You understand how the practical receiver differs from the theoretical models. You know how to model a non-ideal transceiver and how to measure the errors produced by the non-ideal behavior of the transceiver.
You understand the structure of a software project and you are able to participate in a large software project with multiple programmers. You know the basics of problem solving methods and you are able to apply those methods in your own projects.
You understand what the interference is. You can predict how the interference impacts radio links and radio communication systems in general.

content.fi:
Kurssi koostuu viidestä laboratoriotyöstä ja yhdestä itsenäisestä projektista. Laboratoriotöissä luodaan oma radiolähetin ja -vastaanotin käyttämällä GNU-radio ohjelmistoympäristöä. Opiskelija tutustuu ohjelmistoympäristöihin, ohjelmistojen versiohallintaan sekä harjoittelee omien ohjelmistolohkojen luomista.
Itse rakennetun ohjelmistoradiojärjestelmän suorituskykyä selvitetään mittauksin ja testauksin. Samalla niin mittauslaitteet kuin eri ilmiöiden vaikutus radioyhteyksien suorituskykyyn tulee tutuksi.
content.sv:
Kursen består av fem laboratoriearbeten och ett självständigt projekt. Under laboratoriearbeten skapar den studerande sin egen mjukvaruradiosändare och -mottagare genom att använda sig av GNU-radio-programmiljön. Den studerande bekantar sig med olika programmiljöer, versionskontroll, och lär sig hur man skapar och tillägger nya funktioner till mjukvaran.
Den studerande mäter prestandan hos sin självbyggda mjukvaruradion, och samtidigt lär sig känna såväl mätverktyg som de fenomen som påverkar prestandan.
content.en:
The course contains five laboratory works and an independent project. The laboratory works use software radios that are implanted by using the universal software radio platform (USRP) and GNU-radio framework.
During the course, the students study the performance of the software radio transceiver. They learn how the radio performance is described and how it is measured.
By using GNU-radio as an example, students learn how to structure a software project, how to handle version control and how to create and add new functions to the software based transceiver chain.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of the course, the students will be able to
I) explain the benefit from applying error control coding (and determine this more exactly in given situations)
II) apply basic concepts of coding theory (including related algebra)
III) differentiate between block coding and convolutional coding
IV) classify and describe the most important families of codes (in particular, state-of-the-art error-correcting codes)
V) apply a proper decoding scheme to a chosen coding method

content.fi: Error-detecting and error-correcting codes for digital communication and storage. The theory of the most important code classes, including an introduction to turbo and LDPC codes. Coding/decoding algorithms. Applications.
